info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 4:02PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Chester, southwestern York, southeastern Cherokee and northeastern Union Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 402 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Union, or over Lockhart, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chester, Lockhart, Mcconnells, Lowrys, Chester State Park, Monarch Mill, Saratt, Cornwell, Adamsburg and Bullock Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
